location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Captain Frederick Faithfull Commanding the Squadron of Cruisers in the Gulf of Persia

mods.abstract: In response to information provided by Captain Goodbridge that the Shaikh of Umul Gwuyn [Umm al-Qaywayn, i.e. ‘Abdullāh bin Rāshid Āl Mu‘allā] will be visiting Charrack [Bandar-i Chārak], McLeod's letter instructs Faithfull to make enquiries about both places, as well as Sharga [Sharjah] with a view to ascertaining the reason for the Shaikh's visit. MacLeod encloses (not included) a letter on this subject for the shaikhs of Charrack and Umul Gwuyn, and Sultan bin Suggur [Sulṭān bin Ṣaqr Āl Qāsimī].
